divs: sighting detailsi was driving south on i465 on the east side of indianapolis. i took note of the time which was exactly 10:15 a.m. as i looked at the clock on my satellite radio. i was about one or two miles south of u.s.40 (washington street) i saw straight ahead of me a cylindrical object flying west pretty much parallel to the horizon. the position of the sun at that hour and the clarity of the atmosphere made the object gleam a brilliant white. about a month ago we had seen a cylinder going up in the sky which we were never able to see wings on. it looked like a cylinder with a band around it. that sighting coupled with how bright this object made me keep my focus on it even though i was certain it was a plane on it's glide path for indianapolis international. i lived in that part of indy for several years and had seen planes on that glide path many times but i wanted to watch it long enough to see the wings. then i caught sight of a brilliant white sphere well above the plane travelling in a downward path at an angle from about 1 o'clock to 8 o'clock. at first glance it appeared to be on a collision course with the plane but in just a few seconds it became clear that if it continued on it's same trajectory it would be far behind the plane by the time it reached that level. i watched it for about 15 seconds and then it faded away. i say faded but it went from brilliant to gone in less than 2 seconds but still you could tell it was going to become unable to be seen before it did. i am a mufon f.i. so i read the last 20 reports daily. this sphere disappeared exactly like the orb did during the first few seconds of the video 0016 reported 6\30\2010. i thought it might be the first daytime meteor i've ever seen but at that trajectory it was moving too slow to be a meteor.
Summary: Spherical object very bright white in direct sunlight.
